description:
#pyconau

These talks were given at PyCon Australia 2017 which was held from 3-8 August, 2017 in Melbourne, Victoria.

Sam Kitajima-Kimbrel - You Aren't Facebook, and That's OK 0:19
Jason King - Don't do what I did 4:55
Evan Kohilas - Rubber Snaek 9:55
Russell Keith-McGee - Tools for Apiarists 12:13
William Brown - Hard CPUs Make Multithreading 17:23
Allen Rueben - Joining the dots 21:54
Malcolm Ramsay - How I Reinvented Solarized 24:16
Zac Hatfield-Dodds - From REPL to reliable 26:47
Daniel McCarthy - Hexapod and MicroPython 31:55
Lilly Ryan - Towns I Wish I Could Visit 35:35
Jeremy Rothstein - I'm a mockoholic 41:00
Nick Moore - ESP32 and MicroPython 45:54
Katie Bell - Hello 48:38
Peter Hall - A Brief History of 'What is the Time?' 53:37

PyCon Australia is the national conference for users of the Python Programming Language. In August 2017, we're returning to Melbourne, bringing together students, enthusiasts, and professionals with a love of Python from around Australia, and from all over the World. 

August 3-8 2017, Melbourne, Victoria

Python, PyCon, PyConAU
title: Lightning Talks - Sunday
